And please note the bolded as it is good advice that many will condemn themselves because of their own evil actions. 
 
 Jud 1:5 I must remind you-and you know it well-that even though the Lord[fn2] rescued the whole nation of Israel from Egypt, he later destroyed every one of those who did not remain faithful.
 Jud 1:6 And I remind you of the angels who did not stay within the limits of authority God gave them but left the place where they belonged. God has kept them chained in prisons of darkness, waiting for the day of judgment.
 Jud 1:7 And don't forget the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring towns, which were filled with sexual immorality and every kind of sexual perversion. Those cities were destroyed by fire and are a warning of the eternal fire that will punish all who are evil.
 Jud 1:8 Yet these false teachers, who claim authority from their dreams, live immoral lives, defy authority, and scoff at the power of the glorious ones.[fn3]
 Jud 1:9 But even Michael, one of the mightiest of the angels, did not dare accuse Satan of blasphemy, but simply said, "The Lord rebuke you." (This took place when Michael was arguing with Satan about Moses' body.)
 Jud 1:10 But these people mock and curse the things they do not understand. Like animals, they do whatever their instincts tell them, and they bring about their own destruction.
 Jud 1:11 How terrible it will be for them! For they follow the evil example of Cain, who killed his brother. Like Balaam, they will do anything for money. And like Korah, they will perish because of their rebellion.
 Jud 1:12 When these people join you in fellowship meals celebrating the love of the Lord, they are like dangerous reefs that can shipwreck you.[fn4] They are shameless in the way they care only about themselves. They are like clouds blowing over dry land without giving rain, promising much but producing nothing. They are like trees without fruit at harvesttime. They are not only dead but doubly dead, for they have been pulled out by the roots.
 Jud 1:13 They are like wild waves of the sea, churning up the dirty foam of their shameful deeds. They are wandering stars, heading for everlasting gloom and darkness.
 Jud 1:14 Now Enoch, who lived seven generations after Adam, prophesied about these people. He said, "Look, the Lord is coming with thousands of his holy ones.
 Jud 1:15 He will bring the people of the world to judgment. He will convict the ungodly of all the evil things they have done in rebellion and of all the insults that godless sinners have spoken against him."[fn5]
 Jud 1:16 These people are grumblers and complainers, doing whatever evil they feel like. They are loudmouthed braggarts, and they flatter others to get favors in return.
 Jud 1:17 But you, my dear friends, must remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ told you,
 Jud 1:18 that in the last times there would be scoffers whose purpose in life is to enjoy themselves in every evil way imaginable.
 Jud 1:19 Now they are here, and they are the ones who are creating divisions among you. They live by natural instinct because they do not have God's Spirit living in them.
 Jud 1:20 But you, dear friends, must continue to build your lives on the foundation of your holy faith. And continue to pray as you are directed by the Holy Spirit.[fn6]

 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_the_Jews_and_Their_Lies
 
In the treatise, Luther wrote that the Jews are a "base, whoring people, that is, no people of God, and their boast of lineage, circumcision, and law must be accounted as filth."[1] They are full of the "devil's feces ... which they wallow in like swine,"[2] and the synagogue is an "incorrigible whore and an evil slut ..."[3] He argues that their synagogues and schools should be set on fire, their prayer books destroyed, rabbis forbidden to preach, homes razed, and property and money confiscated. They should be shown no mercy or kindness,[4] afforded no legal protection,[5] and these "poisonous envenomed worms" should be drafted into forced labor or expelled for all time.[6] He also seems to advocate their murder, writing "[w]e are at fault in not slaying them."[7]

 You have to believe in a system before you can rebel against it in heresy.
 
 Jesus was a JEW yet he rebelled against those Jewish beliefs. He was a Heretic to Jewish customs and laws.
 Whether you or He valued those rules is beside the point but, I don't ever recall hearing Jesus renounce his Jewishness.
 
 There is no such thing as 'spiritual insight'. 
 It's a made-up term used to elevate yourself above others with 'magical, make-believe knowledge' that doesn't exist.
 
 So, call me a spiritually empty vessel all you want.
 You're just an ignorat fool who doesn't know what you talk about.
 
 The charges that Jesus 'called himself god' is a heretical charge and one of the leading reasons why the Pharasies wanted Him gone.
 That he was a popular heretic that could eventually bring the wrath of Rome down on their heads and lead others to damnation alongside him was icing on the cake.
 But, in the years following, all that was focused on was that the pharasies were power-hungry.
 
 Victors get to write the history...

 
 This would be true, if the alleged Jesus ever existed at all. I know the story books say he did and that he did these things, but there is no primary evidence that he ever existed. Your lack of "spiritual insight" I fear, matches my own.emoticon_xagree
